h3: Answer just a short questionnaire and find out how your ideology compares with that of the rest of Catalan residents in the independence and the left-right debates

text: We have divided ideologies in two of the main axes for Catalan politics: the desired relationship with Spain, and the traditional left-right spectrum from social and economic point of views. With this app, we pinpoint where you are compared with the rest of the Catalan population. Click on the colored squares to find out about the 25 ideological profiles that we have created in this compass. What do you think, where do most people stand? And where would you be positioned in this raster?

We have used all the political barometer surveys the Catalan Opinion Studies Center (CEO) has conducted in the past decade and taken into account the 41,838 polls they have made since 2014. We have grouped the individuals in clusters of political affinity guessing their ideology in both axes by analysing their answers to key questions about social and economic affairs.

This is the most typical political group. They are the individuals within the top 20% most pro-independence feeling among all residents and the top 20% more left-leaning. What do we know about them? All of them have Catalan as their usual language, most of them have superior studies (59%) and over a third are aged 35 to 49 (35%).

Now, what political cluster are you the closest to? Take this short quiz to find out! We put an additional circle (ring) in the plot. You start at the position in the area towards right and against independence because that would be the result if you reply to all questions almost in the middle.

questions.text: What's the language you feel most comfortable with?
How much do you agree with the statement: 'Catalans have a right to decide its future as a land in a referendum'?
Which of the following sentences represents you the most? I feel...
How much do you agree with the statement: ' The less the government intervenes in the economy, the better it will be for the economy'?
How much do you agree with the statement: 'Taxes must be lowered, even if that implies reducing public services and benefits'?
How much do you agree with the statement: 'The government should take action in order to reduce the differences in level income?
How much do you agree with the statement: 'School has to teach children to obey the authority'?
How much do you agree with the statement: 'Religion should have no influence in politics'?
How much do you agree with the statement: 'In all circumstances, the law should always be obeyed'?
How much do you agree with the statement: 'With so much immigration, one no longer feels at home'?
How much do you agree with the statement: 'Economic growth must take priority over environmental protection'?

text: Did you expect this result? Feel free to spend some time exploring your position and the groups that are positioned around you. But there is more to find out about you. Keep scrolling!

Until now, we have grouped people that share political beliefs. Now, you see groups that share some statistical features, like age or education. That shows us that your sociodemographic profile might impact your political beliefs. If you hover over the circles, you will see that older people tend to be more right. Do you find more trends?

Grouping people in such clusters is debatable. To some degree, this reproduces stereotypes. You can click on each circle in order so see a random sample of how each individual group-member stands in the Catalan political Compass. Try to find out which cluster is most homogeneous and heterogeneous!
Let's now compare your position with your sociologic (and not political!) group, that is, with the people with similar age, education and usual language.

questions.text: What province do you live in?
What's the size of your municipality?
What is the maximum level of studies that you have finished?

text: We found your statistical peer group! You are pretty different to its average. Feel free to download and share the result!

Methodology: This project has been created using the data of all the responses collected by Centre d'Estudis d'Opinió (CEO) in all their political barometer surveys since 2014, in which they have gathered information of 41,838 individuals. In order to predict their location in the compass, we have taken into account their responses in two questions of the barometers: their preferred form of state in Catalonia (independent country, federal state within Spain, devolved region, or region with no devolved powers), and where they locate themselves in the left-right axis (0 to 10). Then we observed what each individual responded in other questions raised in the barometers, the ones you found in this quiz. With a statistical model we calculated how much each of their answers influenced the two main questions. Learning the average weight of each of them enabled us to create an equation to predict their answer in the form of state and left-right topics. And why not directly asking them about that? Well, people may not be that honest when explicitly asked, especially in the left-right political spectrum issue! CEO did not ask the questions in this quiz in all their surveys, so in order to build this statistical model despite not having values for all variables in all the respondents, we have imputed some results. That is, we replaced some missing data with estimated values based on the answers we did have. The results you see in the compass are projected, which means that for instance the left-right axis is not going from 0 to 10 taking into account the whole political spectrum, but it is your position compared to the average respondent of the poll. We have divided the two axes in quintiles. Therefore, if you are in the top pro-independence section and in the most left-wing square, this does not necessarily mean that you are a very hardline supporter of a split with Spain and a far-left person, but rather that you are in the top 20% of pro-independence people among Catalans, and among the most 20% left-wing people.

This project was part of the Master in Visual Tools to Empower Citizens (MVTEC) from the Visualization for Transparency Foundation and the University of Girona.
